#Text=Wikinews interviews Kristian Hanson , producer-director of indie horror film ' Sledge '
#Text=Thursday , October 23 , 2014
#Text=File image of a sledge hammer .
#Text=Image : Markscheider .
#Text=Just days away from Halloween , Wikinews interviewed Kristian Hanson , producer-director of independent slasher film Sledge .
#Text=The film has been a recent source of discussion in horror fan circles , primarily due to its production budget of only US$ 800.
#Text=Sledge is Hanson 's fourth film to direct , according to Internet Movie Database .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( WN ) ) How did you come up with the idea for Sledge ?
#Text=Kristian Hanson :
#Text=Sledge came to me while driving home from my brother 's wedding with my wife .
#Text=She told me that I know slashers better than most and I could come up with something fun and unique , and that is exactly what I did with Adam Lynch and the film Sledge .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) What kind of pre-production work did the film require ?
#Text=KH : Pre-Production involved John putting in some ads in the local newspaper and seeing if anyone would be interested in auditioning for the film .
#Text=Planning the death scenes and figuring out what we could do without a budget and without anyone skilled in the ways of Special Effects .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) How did you set up auditions ?
#Text=How many days did you spend auditioning people ?
#Text=KH : Auditions were held a month before filming and that is where Stephanie Tupper came to be involved with the film .
#Text=Everyone else was a friend of John 's and Dustin ( Alex in the film ) showed up by reading about the movie in the local Potsdam Newspaper .
#Text=Without him , Sledge would n't be what it is today .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) How many days went into filming ?
#Text=KH : Four days went in to filming all of the Adam Lynch and camp site stuff .
#Text=The Amish Paradise trailer and also the Couch girl [ character ] segments were also a different day , so a total of six .

#Text=I could say that [ the ] Assly [ character ] was an extra day , but I literally threw up my green screen and hit record on both the intro and outro , so an extra five minutes does n't count in my eyes .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) You 've said elsewhere that the production budget was about $ 800 .
#Text=What were some of the items/services that required buying/payment ?
#Text=KH : The foam prop Sledge hammer , fake intestines , fake knives , [ character ]
#Text=Adam Lynch 's clothes , teeth , contact lenses , the latex for the mask and creating the blood is where all of the money went to .
#Text=Also buying hot dogs , hamburgers for the small crew .
#Text=Again we did n't have a set budget , this was kind of us just throwing our money out there to make this movie happen .
#Text=We did n't have a sheet with expenses etc.
#Text=( ( WN ) ) What else have you directed ? ( ... and what about your co-director ? ? )

#Text=KH : John and I both co-directed the film we made back in April 2012 ( a few months before Sledge ) titled F4L : Friends 4 Life , but that film has not been released and to be honest , I doubt it ever will be .
#Text=It was a learning experience for us and has a lot of humor , but not knowing about copyrights etc , I doubt we would ever be able to release it .
#Text=I would love to remake it in the future though where I could build up the original ending and keep the same script .
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=How old are you ?
#Text=KH :
#Text=I am a whopping 30 years old .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Did you study film in college or have any other formal film-related education ?
#Text=KH :
#Text=When I was in college I took a semester of improv classes but I never went to school for film , and neither has John .
#Text=He is the camera man and director of photography and is all self taught .
#Text=I have a Bachelor 's Degree in Criminal Justice and will have a Master 's Degree in Global Terrorism this upcoming March .
#Text=So when it comes to film , nope , I am self taught in regards to writing and directing .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Who made the mask ? [ worn by the killer ]
#Text=KH : My friend Monster Matt Patterson made the mask .
#Text=I emailed him after writing the Sledge script and told him the basic idea and he just ran with it .
#Text=He did an amazing job .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Did you do any location scouting before shooting ?

#Text=KH : John and Russ ( Nash in the film ) went around [ scouting ] but to be honest , Russ 's dad owned the land where we filmed 90 % of the movie . Adam 's ' Stabbin Cabin ' [ belongs to ] a friend of John 's and that is where we ended up filming that area .
#Text=We had the entire film figured out before we went to shoot thanks to the people that were there to allow us to use their land .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Did the movie appear in any large-scale venues ( cinemas , festivals etc. ) ?

#Text=KH : The film played at the Twisted Tails Film Festival in Dallas , Texas , The Action on Film Festival in Monrovia , California , along with the Indie Fest where it won an Award for Merit in film making .
#Text=We also had a screening in Los Angeles for fans where we had two-hundred people turn up back in June of 2013 , which was surprising and just plain awesome .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) How many days did you spend editing ?
#Text=KH :
#Text=Editing took a long time .
#Text=John spent night after night in his basement cutting and editing Sledge .
#Text=It took three to four months [ ... ]
#Text=I believe , and thankfully Eric Xton of ScarCrow and God in the Machine allowed us to use his music throughout Sledge .
#Text=Without that music , the film would not be what it is today , so a huge thank you to them .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Is the movie available via VOD [ video on demand ] ?

#Text=KH : Yes , Sledge is available on iTunes , Google Play , Playstation Network , Xbox Network and a bunch of other VOD providers , but I do not have a solid list [ apart ] from the main ones I named .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) What 's in store for the sequel ? ?
#Text=KH : In the sequel the movie jumps off where the last one ended but two weeks later .
#Text=We make fun of the fact that this is a small town and in horror films it seems like everyone is a super-model or extremely super good looking .
#Text=Adam Lynch has a lot more fun and a lot more deaths are planned that we intend to show this time .
#Text=SledgeD will be just as fun as the first , with another group of people sitting down to watch Assly and another funny trailer for a made-up movie .
#Text=All in all , it will be a lot of fun , with plenty of blood , horrible jokes and Sledging to go around .
#Text=External sites
#Text=http://www.horrorsociety.com/2013/08/28/sledge-review/
#Text=http://www.sledgemovie.com
